February 10, 1770

Dear Diary,

Today, I am filled with inspiration and gratitude. I have been reading the Sentimental Journey by Laurence Sterne, and it has awakened something within me. I am reminded of the episode of Maria of Moulines, which I have always found particularly moving. The way Sterne weaves together sentiment and humor, creating a narrative that is both poignant and thought-provoking, has left me in awe.

As I reflect on my own life and experiences, I am struck by the similarities between Sterne's journey and my own. Like Sterne, I have been on a journey of self-discovery, seeking to understand the world and its inhabitants. And like Sterne, I have been moved by the beauty and suffering of humanity.

I have decided to write my own sentimental journey, inspired by Sterne's work. I will call it "Die Tagereise" (The Day's Journey). I will draw on my own experiences and observations, as well as the ideas and emotions that Sterne has so skillfully conveyed.

As I begin to write, I am filled with excitement and trepidation. I know that I will be taking a risk, attempting to capture the essence of Sterne's style and sentiment. But I am confident that my own unique voice and perspective will shine through.

I am also aware that I will be drawing on Sterne's work, and I hope that he will not mind. I am inspired by his example, and I believe that my own work will be a worthy tribute to his genius.

As I sit down to write, I am filled with a sense of purpose and determination. I will pour my heart and soul into this work, and I hope that it will bring joy and inspiration to those who read it.

Yours truly,
Johann Christian Bock
